question_text: A print job intended for pre-printed letterhead keeps printing from the tray loaded with plain paper, even though the user selected the correct template. What is the most likely reason?
answer_options: The printer is out of toner
The selected print orientation conflicts with the tray
The media type for the letterhead tray is not properly defined
The print spooler service is disabled
correct_answer: The media type for the letterhead tray is not properly defined
explanation: Printers rely on media type definitions to route jobs to the correct tray. If the letterhead tray isnâ€™t set up with the appropriate media type, the printer may fall back to a default tray.
